intro: Mesembryanthemum acrosepalum, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant features fleshy, often blue or purple, leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals that open during the day. It is commonly grown as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and vibrant blooms.
